text: A bit off HubSpot topic, but would love to hear some suggestions for emebedded styled maps for a company location page. I use mapbox way back in the day and this is the first time I am hearing of snazzymaps. wondering if there is anything else out there folks use
Snazzymaps is really just styling for google maps
It's been a few years since I used mapbox, but my experience with that was pretty solid
illustrate your own map, export as SVG and add whatever functionality you need to the SVG :nerd_face:

pro tip: if you use an SVG you can manipulate it’s viewbox to recreate the zooming and panning functionality
Example by the best SVG wiz there ever wuz:
<https://css-tricks.com/interactive-data-visualization-animating-viewbox/>

Thanks everyone <@U54TVT3C1> <@U7V9DQ31P> <@U7SL518D6> been a while since I had to implement one and from the number of HubSpot portals it sounds like you guys deal with, I'm guessing you've probs built one or two location pages for a client

Another tip if you go the SVG route - label your layers in illustrator and group layers based on how you think you might later need to animate or interact with them.

The groups and layer names translate to ID’s and `g` elements in the svg making life easier
